par.text: Cadmium is a soft and ductile metal, silvery-white in colour with a bluish tinge. On contact with air it becomes covered with a thin layer of cadmium oxide - CdO - and loses its shine. When heated strongly, cadmium burns with a red flame. It dissolves in acids and reacts with water vapour. Cadmium and its compounds are toxic and carcinogenic.
